[Docks.]

The rickety dock gives way to soft packed soil.  A freshly made path cuts through the dense forest vegetation to the west. The smell of fresh lumber wafts through the air. A large magnificent building has been built next to the last step of the docks. Travelers pause and take a glance into the beautiful window front of the building, their pleasure at seeing such nice items is evident on their faces.  Some flapping colorful flags, a ship shaped rosewood hanging sign, and an open dazzling painted lemonwood door are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st local farmer, the 1st psycian town crier, the 2nd psycian town crier, the 2nd local farmer, the 1st townsman, the 2nd townsman, the 3rd psycian town crier, the 4th psycian town crier, the 5th psycian town crier, and the 1st townsman.

l
>[Docks.]

Mud and muck cover the roadway and pier, testament to the high traffic in the area. Men and women unload large cargo ships. Enormous quantities of food come into the city from the docks, and many other goods besides. Goods are moved into the city via the new trade road to the northwest. A pile of lumber stands nearby for future improvements.  An open small oak crate and an open small oak crate are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast south northwest.
s
>[Docks.]

A long pier runs along the river here, the warehouse that stands nearby with its doors open sees much use. Of all the piers here along the riverfront, this one seems the busiest. The large majority of the food shipments come through here.  An open wooden door is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southwest.
sw
>[Docks.]

The rickety dock gives way to soft packed soil.  A freshly made path cuts through the dense forest vegetation to the west. The smell of fresh lumber wafts through the air. A large magnificent building has been built next to the last step of the docks. Travelers pause and take a glance into the beautiful window front of the building, their pleasure at seeing such nice items is evident on their faces.  Some flapping colorful flags, a ship shaped rosewood hanging sign, and an open dazzling painted lemonwood door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* south northwest.
s
>[Docks.]

Beside the bridge spanning the Darkith, a short pier reaches out into the river. The nearby warehouse stands ready for cargo from down river, its doors open. A large winch is mounted on the side of the bridge for especially heavy cargoes.  A bridge and an open door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north*.

[Docks.]

A tall bridge spans the Darkith to the docks on the far side. The docks on this side of the river spread out to the north while the offices of the Seamen's Guild are through a door to the south. A gate also leads to Spur's fairground to the south.  A bridge, an open wooden door, and an open gleaming red and green iron gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast east.

You are in a wide strip of field that runs along the main road leading into Spur's residential district. The local constabulary sees to it that vagrants don't try to bed down here. They direct them to the field to the southeast.

To the northwest and southeast of the road at this point, wide open fields stretch out invitingly. At all times of the year, poor travelers can be found camping here in lieu of paying for a room at an inn somewhere in the city.

[Road.]

Even though it shows heavy wear, the road is in remarkably good repair. It was built by expert craftsmen to withstand the rigors of time and use. Evidence of recent repairs indicate that any problems are dealt with quickly and competently.  A broken old wooden trash wagon is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south* southwest.
n
>[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  A rainbow silk tent, an open iron gate, and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south* west*.
go te
>[Peddler's tent.]

Sawdust covers the ground inside this large, colorful tent. The air is filled with spicy scents and the sound of haggling and clinking coins. Goods from the four corners of the world are offered for sale. In the corner draped with beautiful multicolored silks, a small booth has been erected.  An exit, a fresh painted sign pointing northeast, and a sun and moon trimmed sign are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

l
>[Peddler's tent.]

Sawdust covers the ground inside this large, colorful tent. The air is filled with spicy scents and the sound of haggling and clinking coins. Goods from the four corners of the world are offered for sale. In the corner draped with beautiful multicolored silks, a small booth has been erected.  An exit, a fresh painted sign pointing northeast, and a sun and moon trimmed sign are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Fleur's Pets.]

Wood shavings cover the ground under the colorful tent in this corner. A rough wooden fence incloses a large portion of the area creating a closed off circle. Inside the enclosure are several well made cages of various sizes.   A closed filigree brass cage door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* southeast* south*.

l
[Festival of Magick, Levitating Disc.]

The platform on which you stand is made out of a thick glass, lending a distorted view of clouds and stars lazily passing beneath it. A powerful, softly humming force provides an unseen wall for safety of its passengers as the platform floats mysteriously upon the air. Within the bubble of energy, be it day or night, the air glows a combination of fiery reds and oranges against a darkened blue. Stars faintly glow and twinkle in the dusty light of both the sun and the moon.  A thick transparent glass platform, some glowing twinkling stars, a fiery sunset of varying hues, some floating glass steps, and some misty grey spiraling clouds heading down are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: None.
go ste
>[Festival of Magick, Entrance.]

An ornate wrought iron fence, detailed with the various runes for each class, surrounds a raised platform in the center of the area; the runes glow and pulsate. The clouds beneath your feet give gently with each footstep, leaving ethereal impressions momentarily before fluffing back up. Above, the sky is alive with streaks of lightening that dance back and forth between more clouds and illuminate the orange-red sky with flashes of brilliant white. Misty letters swirl before you, shifting and melding together into sentences.  Some fluffy white clouds, some glowing dancing lightning streaks, some misty swirling words in the sky, a hovering oak door partially open, an open runesilver handled glass trapdoor, and some floating glass steps are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st brown speckled white gyrfalcon (wearing a small gold collar).
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* southwest* west*.
go door
>[Magick Festival, Tavern and Stage.]

Passing through the door, you have entered another plane of existence. The night sky folds like dark blue runesilk against a backdrop of twinkling stars. A large moon shines its soft brilliance upon a floating glass stage, providing a natural spotlight to those performing. Tables and chairs hover a few feet from the floor, covered in a rich velvety green grass, while small levitating discs act as stairs to and from them. Tumultuous light flashes behind the door, leading back to the entrance of the Faire.  A softly illuminated moon and shining stars, some magickally suspended tables, some magickally suspended chairs, a circular glass levitating stage, and a hovering oak door partially open are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>
The misty swirling words in the sky reads:
"Welcome to the Magick Festival! Magick Shoppe and Show are southeast. Fine apparel and adornments are southwest. Peddles are east and west. Tournament grounds are north. The doors here lead to the tavern and events, respectively."
se
>[Smoke and Mirrors Magick Shoppe.]

Clear, thick runic-etched glass makes up the walls and floor of this room, each giving a spectacular view of the festival grounds. A large display case floats midair, displaying an array of fantastical items. Small sun and moon shaped orbs orbit around each other, casting a greenish light upon the glass. At first glance, there does not appear to exit, but a flickering of shifting of scenery against one wall indicates it is only an illusion.  A glowing hovering yellowed sunstone orb, a glowing hovering bluish moonstone orb, and an open translucent pale blue silk curtain are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: None.

>[Smoke and Mirrors Magick Shoppe.]

Clear, thick runic-etched glass makes up the walls and floor of this room, each giving a spectacular view of the festival grounds. A large display case floats midair, displaying an array of fantastical items. Small sun and moon shaped orbs orbit around each other, casting a greenish light upon the glass. At first glance, there does not appear to exit, but a flickering of shifting of scenery against one wall indicates it is only an illusion.  A glowing hovering yellowed sunstone orb, a glowing hovering bluish moonstone orb, and an open translucent pale blue silk curtain are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: None.

l through cur
>It looks like an open translucent pale blue silk curtain.
>[Magick Festival, Show.]

A runesilver trimmed crystalla stage floats inches above the ground toward the front of the room. Black velvet pillows with gold threaded tassels are scattered around the white marble floor to provide comfortable seating. Hanging from the white and blue marble walls are intricate wrought iron candle holders. The black rune-carved candles within their glass votive flicker a cool blue flame, softly illuminating the area.  Some wrought iron entwined glass votives, a circular runesilver trimmed crystalla stage, and an open translucent pale blue silk curtain are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: None.
go ill
>[Festival of Magick, Entrance.]

An ornate wrought iron fence, detailed with the various runes for each class, surrounds a raised platform in the center of the area; the runes glow and pulsate. The clouds beneath your feet give gently with each footstep, leaving ethereal impressions momentarily before fluffing back up. Above, the sky is alive with streaks of lightening that dance back and forth between more clouds and illuminate the orange-red sky with flashes of brilliant white. Misty letters swirl before you, shifting and melding together into sentences.  Some fluffy white clouds, some glowing dancing lightning streaks, some misty swirling words in the sky, a hovering oak door partially open, an open runesilver handled glass trapdoor, and some floating glass steps are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st brown speckled white gyrfalcon (wearing a small gold collar).
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* southwest* west*.
sw
>[Magick Festival, Fanciful Adornments.]

There are no corners to this room; everything is spherical and smooth. The marble that makes up the walls are smooth, veined with obsidian and amethyst. A crystal display case lays flat on a transparent glass floor, in order to provide customers sure footing. Fanciful clothing has been folded perfectly, displayed in rows within the case. A smaller rack displays a few interesting jewelry pieces. A sign reading EXIT hangs mysteriously to the northeast of the area. Occasionally, a flicker and outline of a door gives the illusion of an actual exit.  Some sparkling multicolored crystal display cases and a glowing faux circular window viewing a sunset are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: None.

go ste
>[Festival of Magick, Levitating Disc.]

The platform on which you stand is made out of a thick glass, lending a distorted view of clouds and stars lazily passing beneath it. A powerful, softly humming force provides an unseen wall for safety of its passengers as the platform floats mysteriously upon the air. Within the bubble of energy, be it day or night, the air glows a combination of fiery reds and oranges against a darkened blue. Stars faintly glow and twinkle in the dusty light of both the sun and the moon.  A thick transparent glass platform, some glowing twinkling stars, a fiery sunset of varying hues, some floating glass steps, and some misty grey spiraling clouds heading down are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: None.

[Road.]

The road coming in from the north bends around to the southwest here as it makes its way through an open field. Used by travelers most of the year, the fields host parties and day excursions from the city in good weather.  A frozen jagged lightning bolt is here.

>[Road.]

The main north road has a branch here leading off to the east. A small sign posted at this intersection sports arrows pointing in all five directions. An open field lies off to the west and another to the southeast.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north east southeast south* west.
[Road.]

Even though it shows heavy wear, the road is in remarkably good repair. It was built by expert craftsmen to withstand the rigors of time and use. Evidence of recent repairs indicate that any problems are dealt with quickly and competently.  A broken old wooden trash wagon is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rogue.
Obvious paths: north south* southwest.
[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  A rainbow silk tent, an open iron gate, and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south* west*.
go gate
>[South Gate.]

A well-guarded gateway separates the city's residential district from the farmlands just beyond. Guards carefully eye all that enter or exit the city, beckoning gruffly to random travelers for a closer inspection. The structure of the guards' barracks is visible above the road to the west. A weathered wooden sign is posted by the gate.  An open iron gate, a wooden sign, a street lantern, an open thick stone door, and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This room is illuminated.

>[Noble Way.]

The occasional locked gate marks the entrance to some of the more hidden estates of Spurs nobility. From this broad avenue, little can be seen of their splendor. Behind the imposing gate recedes a proud drive, disappearing mysteriously into the trees. If not for the large imposing tower rising above the hedges it would be hard to discern anything was beyond the gate. It is apparent the residents do not wish to be disturbed.  A street lantern, a closed morbius door, and an open black iron gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Noble Way.]

Majestic elms continue to line this broad roadway, sheltering the avenue on both sides and further enhancing the grandiose atmosphere. Fronting the beautiful homes, cobbled paths edged with narrow flower beds meander through nearby private gardens. Though they appear wonderful places to spend an afternoon or take a picnic, the glances from those tending the estates makes it clear they are only for the invited.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Noble Crossroads.]

A small roadway bordered by flowering hedges bisects the wide avenue of Noble Way at a right angle, heading east to west.  A thick, sturdy sign stands just off to the side of a charming path, its large friendly letters intent on luring travelers into the city's premiere roadstay, the Gilded Lion Inn. The entrance is clearly marked and welcoming, extending off to the southeast.  A wooden sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* west*.

>[Noble Way.]

Occasional gates and driveways lead back into the well-kept estates of the city's nobility, breaking and adding interest to the defining plane of the walls lining Noble Way. The rest of the street seems to mimic the splendor of the estates beyond the wall. Swept and trimmed, the roadway exudes a simple, yet beautiful elegance.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Noble Way.]

Numerous trees lining the avenue serve as the dividing border between the majestic estates of the nobility and the lightly traveled roadway. The estates themselves are noticeably closer to the avenue than those to the south. However, they are no easier to access, still protected by their own guarding walls, some covered with ivy or colorful blooming vines.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Noble Way.]

The entire avenue is composed of fine cobblestone, each level with its neighbor, providing a smooth ride for passing carriages and horses. The stones were customized by craftsmen, cut to order, rather than simply placed wherever they might fit. A few stately oaks and elms line the sides of the road, shading travelers during the daylight hours.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Intersection.]

The avenue comes to a fork, with Noble Way curving from south to the northwest. A side-street heading off to the east leads to an extremely well kept neighborhood that easily surpasses everything around it in splendor and magnificence. Everything, even the carefully pruned trees and the manicured shrubbery displays a desire for elegant perfection.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south* northwest*.

>[Noble Way.]

Leaving the exceptionally wealthy estates of the Spurian nobility, Noble Way heads toward the Town Square to the northwest. Along the roadside can be seen the in-city homes of successful merchants and other wealthy citizens of the Spur. The homes display a slightly different style, perhaps they are not quite so restrained; a touch more exuberance and freedom with materials is displayed.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
[Noble Way.]

Gazing down each of the nearby private drives reveals a glimpse of a luxurious home, each a miniature estate in its own right. Short, stout walls and manicured hedges serve to keep out the riffraff and to protect the small, expensive gardens. Every detail has been attended to display the exotic plants, in all their pampered perfection.  A street lantern and a closed rosewood door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southeast*.
[Noble Way.]

Noble Way continues to wind its way among the rather modestly sized, but elegant, homes of the Spur's successful. Many a peasant farmer may live in homes larger than these, but none can match the quality found here. A peaceful, luxurious feeling pervades this part of town; perhaps it is the drifting floral scents wafting from the well-tended gardens.  A closed elegant black iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Noble Way.]

Many grand, even ostentatious, homes line this stretch of Noble Way. Most of the residents here were fortunate enough to be born into the right families. Few that live in this area have ever actually had to work for a living. Glancing at the nameplates reveals many of the recognizable names of the Spur. Some of these names could almost be considered famous.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* south*.

>[Noble Way.]

An unusually large home, even for this part of town, lies off to the west. It seems as if one ambitious owner is slowly buying up the lots next to his and adding them to his own. Groundskeepers are at work in the surrounding gardens, trimming and raking, so intent on their work they do not bother to acknowledge the passing traffic on the road.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Noble Way.]

To the north, you can make out an ornately scrolled gateway set in the base of the imposing city wall. The refined roadway of Noble Way stretches out to the south. The cobblestones of the road are smooth and even. The attention to detail shown here is a dramatic change from some of the other parts of the city.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Gateway.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. They seem to take a greater interest in this part of town, though there does not seem to be anything threatening enough here to warrant such attention.  A street lantern, an open iron gate, and a gilded silver plaque are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

>[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, an open Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west.
n
[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack, a street lantern, and a lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, a short wooden stick, a slightly dented brass buckler, and a tattered old book of notes are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lycas the Noble San Elf, Coraxi the San Elf, Thistlethorn the Flerian, Blade the Noble Thugian, and Solinus the Human.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

>[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, a short wooden stick, a slightly dented brass buckler, and a tattered old book of notes are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lycas the Noble San Elf, Coraxi the San Elf, Thistlethorn the Flerian, Blade the Noble Thugian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Crax the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human, and Isahn the Psycian (holding a glowing azure crystal star of Psycia).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
>
Isahn's head suddenly begins glowing. He places a hand upon his chest. The glow travels down an arm to his hand. The glow quickly spreads over Isahn's entire body, then fades away.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, a short wooden stick, a slightly dented brass buckler, and a tattered old book of notes are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Coraxi the San Elf, Thistlethorn the Flerian, Blade the Noble Thugian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Crax the Noble Leuian, Anyah the Human, Isahn the Psycian (holding a glowing azure crystal star of Psycia), Nae'blis the Noble Arachnian, and Orent the San Elf.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

>[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.
w
[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A freshly painted oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east*.

go gate
>[Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion.  Guards stand sentry from atop the wall as well as the ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: west*.
w
w
w
>[Trade Way.]

Many townsfolk pass along this busy thoroughfare. Rich and poor alike mix freely on this street, much to the dismay of a passing nobleman. A young human struggles with an armful of packages and two young children in tow. Those in need of goods or supplies head west towards the market, those looking for the news of the day head east towards Town Square.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
w
[Trade Way, Intersection.]

The monotonous line of dull grey buildings separate, revealing a massive domed building. The front walls of the building are dominated by glass panels displaying the latest fashions from several of the stores inside.  A pair of women carrying several shopping bags spin through the glass revolving doors while two grumpy looking men drag behind them with even larger bags. A large banner over the revolving doors proudly displays the name, "The Galleria", for all to see.   A street lantern and an open gold trimmed revolving glass door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.
[Trade Way.]

The well-worn road is crowded with groups of adventuring souls on their way to barter, unlock, and bank their wages. A constant stream travels to the south, into a small but well-tended courtyard. The rest rush past, hoping to thwart those that cling to the shadows and ply their darker trades with nimble fingers.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.
[Trade Way.]

The cobblestone roadbed has been worn to nearly flat along this part of Trade Way. Carts, wagons, foot traffic and shoppers clog this busy thoroughfare between the successful pawnshop to the north and the bank to the south.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Imperial Trader's Galleria, Main Hall.]

In this grand hall, your eyes are instantly drawn upwards to the glittering geodesic dome ceiling. Held together with a dizzying amount of wrought iron latticework and interlocking crystal panes, light pours in during the day, casting tiny rainbows throughout the interior, to the delight of small Frontacian children. At night strategically placed light crystals cast soft but ample light. The white marble floor beneath you is expertly polished, and a well-kept garden centerpiece surrounded by teak benches provides a leisurely atmosphere to the area. Dazzling arrays of diverse shops surround you, each sporting differently decorated doors, signs and display windows.  Some teak benches and an open gold trimmed revolving glass door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* northeast* east* south* southwest west* northwest*.
shop list all
>There is no shop here!
n
>[Imperial Trader's Galleria.]

Two large glass display windows housing a brilliant array of gems and jewelry glisten brightly in the light provided from the overhead glass dome. Nestled between the two windows is a finely detailed frosted glass door. The marble flooring leading up to the door is polished to a glossy finish. A colorful awning stretching out from window to window provides enough shade from the sky light above to allow shoppers to peer into the windows and admire the true beauty of the jewelry on display.  A diamond shaped wooden sign and an open diamond cut frosted glass door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: south*.
shop list all
>There is no shop here!

go fro
>[W. Jewelers]

Elegantly crafted moonstone sconces on each side of the entrance light this spacious jewelry store on even the darkest of evenings while the skylight overhead has been encrusted with several crushed diamonds, casting a rainbow glow throughout the building during the day. The abundance of light helps gives each gem the attention they need to show off their true color. The room itself is made of several black velvet topped glass counters that have been arranged into the shape of a horseshoe. Each counter is divided into two sections; one side for displaying lose gems and uncut stones, the other for finished jewelry that is ready to be sold. To the rear of the building is a small desk with a glowing rune-enscribed lamp sitting on it. The desk is cluttered with loose gems that have yet to be examined. A small bookshelf rises up from the back of the desk containing several books on gems and minerals. A single solid black book labeled "borrowed goods" has been tucked away at the end of the shelf.   An open diamond cut frosted glass door, a closed velvet topped glass counter, a closed velvet topped glass counter, a closed highly polished duskwood jewelry chiffonier, and some intricately carved teak chairs are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
shop list all

>[Imperial Trader's Galleria.]

Looking somewhat our of place among the landscape of polished white marble, a strange store lies here. Set into the silvery lacquered teak shop front, a pair of glass display windows flank the foreign door. Customers peer into the displays as they pass, always noticing a new exotic luxury. A purple and silver decorative awning overhangs the front piece, the woven silk subtly billowing in passing breezes.  Just above the door, a sign written in a spidery script reads, "The Imports House Fantastico" in inlaid silver. A pair of passing Frontacian children tug at the sleeve of their mother, begging her to take them into the mysterious establishment.  A curiously lettered silver sign and an open exotic sliding mahogany door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southeast*.
shop list all
>There is no shop here!
go door
>[Imports House Fantastico, Premier Branch.]

The black marble floor of this strange establishment has a glossy finish, but it casts little sheen. Inconsistent and irregular light flickers from candles placed strategically in mirrored niches around the establishment. The walls and ceiling are swathed with colored silks, in deep regal purples, blues and blacks, interwoven with shimmering metallic thread. A few brass incense burners also hang from the ceiling, emitting subtle but unrecognizable scents. Polished sandstone counters support some low glass and black velvet display cases, hosting strange and varied items. Towards the rear, a black lacquered desk is covered in oddly lettered scrolls, ink maps and intricate diagrams of unknown design. A purple robed go-blin-al pours over the desk, glancing up on occasion to answer a customer's question.   A closed saltwater stained lemonwood sea chest, a closed saltwater stained lemonwood sea chest, and an open exotic sliding mahogany door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
shop list all
>

>[Imperial Trader's Galleria.]

Looking somewhat our of place among the landscape of polished white marble, a strange store lies here. Set into the silvery lacquered teak shop front, a pair of glass display windows flank the foreign door. Customers peer into the displays as they pass, always noticing a new exotic luxury. A purple and silver decorative awning overhangs the front piece, the woven silk subtly billowing in passing breezes.  Just above the door, a sign written in a spidery script reads, "The Imports House Fantastico" in inlaid silver. A pair of passing Frontacian children tug at the sleeve of their mother, begging her to take them into the mysterious establishment.  A curiously lettered silver sign and an open exotic sliding mahogany door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southeast*.
se
>[Imperial Trader's Galleria, Main Hall.]

In this grand hall, your eyes are instantly drawn upwards to the glittering geodesic dome ceiling. Held together with a dizzying amount of wrought iron latticework and interlocking crystal panes, light pours in during the day, casting tiny rainbows throughout the interior, to the delight of small Frontacian children. At night strategically placed light crystals cast soft but ample light. The white marble floor beneath you is expertly polished, and a well-kept garden centerpiece surrounded by teak benches provides a leisurely atmosphere to the area. Dazzling arrays of diverse shops surround you, each sporting differently decorated doors, signs and display windows.  Some teak benches and an open gold trimmed revolving glass door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* northeast* east* south* southwest west* northwest*.
ne
>[Imperial Trader's Galleria.]

Two rune-etched golden dragon statues on either side of the doorway stand guard protectively outside the shop. Inside the mouth of each dragon is a series of glowing runes that shoot out a small spark to give the appearance of fire while providing adequate lighting for those entering. The golden dragons cast a small shadow across the gleaming white marble floors below. A rune embedded beaded curtain sways silently between the statues, allowing easy passage to and from the store.  A sunstone trimmed rosewood sign and a twinkling rune beaded curtain are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southwest*.
shop list all

>I don't see what you are referring to.

>[Imperial Enchantments.]

Softly glowing golden orbs float about illuminating the shop with a mystical light. Runes embedded in the store's stucco walls blink and glitter adding life to their dark crimson paint. Polished mahogany shelves showcase the organized assortment of magickal trinkets and weapons while a glass display case boasts a collection of potions and other concoctions. A large attendant stands protectively in front of a locked cabinet filled with dangerous looking items. He keeps a watchful eye on a pair of Frontacian children chasing each other around with crackling display wands as their parents browse about oblivious to their actions.  A closed large rune lit glass cabinet and a twinkling rune beaded curtain are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Imperial Trader's Galleria.]

Squares of sunlight from the atrium ceiling pass over a teak door, unmarked save for a tiny placard that reads 'Xaphania's Closet'. A pair of strolling Frontacian noblewomen stop suddenly and rush inside arm-in-arm. A few moments later, an elegant San Elf laden with parcels sashays through the door, her stilettos clicking across the white marble floor. Just beside the entrance, a lanky Usil girl stands before a display window with a look of awe mixed with envy. An impatient Human sits on a nearby bench, drumming his fingers on a hatbox.  A plain looking potted fern and an open serpent handled teak door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: west*.
go door
>[Xaphania's Closet.]

The air is uncomfortably warm in the cramped store. Clothing fills nearly every corner of the dim room; spilling over shelves, crowding racks, and piling in corners and on stools. The majority of the clothing hangs with little sign of order on a wooden rod that runs along one side of the long, thin space. Gilded antique mirrors adorn every unoccupied bit of wall. The back of the store hosts a cluster of pedestals of varying heights, a pair of shoes adorning each one. A few carefully placed sconces provide just enough light to illuminate select pieces of merchandise and cause the polished teak floor to gleam. A few well-dressed mannequins are placed inconveniently throughout the area causing further crowding amongst shoppers. Muffled voices giving opinions on outfits can be heard from behind the dressing room curtain. A Sanene woman lurks in the shadows waiting to assist you.  A well dressed mannequin, a pair of crystal pumps on a pedestal, a large antique gilded mirror, and an open serpent handled teak door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Imperial Trader's Galleria.]

A smooth white polished marble floor is dotted with beautiful wrought iron benches. A potted fuchsia tree rises from the center of the courtyard toward the light of the beautiful geodesic ceiling. The sweeping branches cast cool shadows across both the area and the benches nestled beneath. A small quaint door is nestled within the beautiful sea green marble tiles that make up the front of this bookstore. The windows on either side of the rune crested door are a cloudy white, what treasures held behind them carefully concealed. "The Dusty Pages," in glistening gold filigree, is etched into the tiles on the right side of the door.  An open rune crested wooden door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north*.
go door
>[The Dusty Pages.]

The filtered light from the window barely reaches through to the room. A few floating candles hover in the air providing minimal light where the window cannot. The shades of light dance upon the mountains of books that fill this room. From ceiling to floor, this store has been filled to the brim with all sorts of books: ancient looking leather bound books whose bindings have come loose, mysterious dark tomes, covered in ancient runes, and thick codices of lore and history from times long past. Volume upon volume have been stacked high forming large columns of books. The labyrinth of tomes conceals a stairway leading down to a wooden door. In the back, a wrinkled old Usil sits quietly behind the counter reading a book of his own.  Some tall stacks of books, a closed glass framed mahogany bookshelf, an open rune crested wooden door, and a closed silver rune-etched mahogany door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Imperial Trader's Galleria.]

The delicate fragrance of fresh roses wafts in through a beautiful ruby arched door. A large black awning softens the glare from the overhead light and creates an alluring atmosphere. To the left of the arch, a small window displays a number of different lotions and titillating adult items.  A picnic basket filled with several aphrodisiacs, a bottle of champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries sits below a scantily clad mannequin dressed in a ravishing black silk negligee. A dowdy priggish looking woman shields her young son's eyes as she quickly ushers him past the shop.  An open ruby encrusted arched door is here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Temptations]

The sweet smelling aroma of fresh cut roses combined with fragrant scented oils from a nearby display table greets visitors romantically as they enter the store. Several small tables draped in shiny black silks have been set up around the shop, each showing off a certain theme of items. A single rack of clothing in the rear offers a sexy selection of evening wear that is sure to compliment the oils and lotions on display at the front of the store. A drawn velvet curtain offers privacy to customers wanting to try on some of the more revealing outfits. A soft glow from the many candles throughout the room adds to the seductive atmosphere. A lovely delicately elven maiden smiles warmly at you from behind the counter, waiting to assist your every need. Just behind her is a wide assortment of fine wines and breathtaking goblets designed for romantic evenings. The counter is filled with rich chocolates and other sensual foods that are sure to set the mood no matter what the occasion.  A closed glass topped mahogany case and an open ruby encrusted arched door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

[South Merchant Avenue.]

Larger, more extravagant shops fill the end of this road. There are Thugian guards stationed outside several of the shops, eyeing the customers warily. The guard closest to you is currently engaged in the enlightened task of picking his nose. A young Psycian couple is speaking loudly with the proprietor of a jewelry shop about the ring on the female's finger. Large puffs of smoke emanate from several Drag-al, seated outside the cigar shop across the street.  An open darkened cherry wood door and a closed oliphant etched sapphire door are here.

This room is illuminated.

>[Vision of Eternity.]

Clear crystal display cases sit interspersed on gold-veined black marble flooring, giving a perfect view of items for sale. A soft charming glow reflects from rune symbols embedded in the darkened cherry wood walls. Tiny crystal prisms dangle from the ceiling, catching the light as they stir faintly from a mysterious unseen wind that lightly circulates around the store. The only things out of place in this elegant environment are paintings on the walls of a Leuian and a lawn gnome in various locations as well as a lawn gnome in the front of the shop, with a card in front of it entitled, "Dufus."  A brightly painted grinning lawn gnome and an open darkened cherry wood door are here.

This room is illuminated.

>[Raptorian's Sugar and More.]

To one side of the room are several large barrels filled to the very top with sugar. The air is filled with the smell of the many kinds of sweets, pastries, and confections contained within the shop's main counter, which is made of large panels of blue sapphire, set in a golden frame and cut thinly enough to be transparent, lending a slight bluish tinge to the goods contained within. Behind the counter, a drake-shaped blue statue sits on a shelf below a large banner, which reads, "Why go to Rathan or Saldaea for your sweet needs when I provide them right here?" Below this banner, a smaller one reads "Sugar is not the only thing sold here." Next to the statue is a small disclaimer set in a sapphire frame. Hanging from the ceiling is a large, stuffed, fuzzy, winged pink oliphant.  A blue statue of a drake, a disclaimer sign, and an open oliphant etched sapphire door are here.

This room is illuminated.

Raptorian fans his wings at you.
go door
[South Merchant Avenue.]

Larger, more extravagant shops fill the end of this road. There are Thugian guards stationed outside several of the shops, eyeing the customers warily. The guard closest to you is currently engaged in the enlightened task of picking his nose. A young Psycian couple is speaking loudly with the proprietor of a jewelry shop about the ring on the female's finger. Large puffs of smoke emanate from several Drag-al, seated outside the cigar shop across the street.  An open darkened cherry wood door and an open oliphant etched sapphire door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* south*.
go door
>[Vision of Eternity.]

Clear crystal display cases sit interspersed on gold-veined black marble flooring, giving a perfect view of items for sale. A soft charming glow reflects from rune symbols embedded in the darkened cherry wood walls. Tiny crystal prisms dangle from the ceiling, catching the light as they stir faintly from a mysterious unseen wind that lightly circulates around the store. The only things out of place in this elegant environment are paintings on the walls of a Leuian and a lawn gnome in various locations as well as a lawn gnome in the front of the shop, with a card in front of it entitled, "Dufus."  A brightly painted grinning lawn gnome and an open darkened cherry wood door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Raptorian's Sugar and More.]

To one side of the room are several large barrels filled to the very top with sugar. The air is filled with the smell of the many kinds of sweets, pastries, and confections contained within the shop's main counter, which is made of large panels of blue sapphire, set in a golden frame and cut thinly enough to be transparent, lending a slight bluish tinge to the goods contained within. Behind the counter, a drake-shaped blue statue sits on a shelf below a large banner, which reads, "Why go to Rathan or Saldaea for your sweet needs when I provide them right here?" Below this banner, a smaller one reads "Sugar is not the only thing sold here." Next to the statue is a small disclaimer set in a sapphire frame. Hanging from the ceiling is a large, stuffed, fuzzy, winged pink oliphant.  A blue statue of a drake, a disclaimer sign, and an open oliphant etched sapphire door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Luminita the Secian (seated) and Raptorian the Noble Secian (lying down).
Obvious exits: None.
bow to r deeply, his huge tree-like body bent almost in half

>You bow to Luminita deeply, his huge tree-like body bent almost in half.

>[South Merchant Avenue.]

Shops along this portion of South Merchant Avenue have been built larger and more extravagant. Large throngs of people can be seen clustered about several of the store windows, gazing in at the merchandise. The proprietor of a sweets store, which displays an impressive array of various candies and chocolates, is continually ushering small children away from his windows.  A bright orange and black satin banner over the door, an open ruby-studded dragon-etched steel door, and an open sapphire inlaid bluesteel door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* south.
go door
>[Rawcliffe's Emporium]

Cool gold-flecked crimson marble covers the floor in this elegant shop. Tall displays of armor line two of the four walls. The other two walls are lined with walnut display cases. Beautiful weapons sit within the large cases cushioned by black velvet. Hanging on the walls behind the weapon cases are a variety of shields. Each distinctive for its design and durability. A tiny drag-al sits high on a stool, slowly swishing his tail, he eyes the customers waiting for any sign they may have a question.  An open ruby-studded dragon-etched steel door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Mieglyn's Song, Sacks, Shields and Such]

Warm homey scents assail your senses as you wander in to this quaint shop.  Simmering potpourri pots placed through out the room are the source of these comforting scents. The comfortable feelings that surround you make you want to linger in this cheerfully cluttered shop. A small sapphire winged Secian statue stands near the door, cheerfully holding a sign that says, "Welcome all shoppers." The shop owner's eclectic tastes are illustrated with the variety of items for sale. Along one wall are musical instruments of all kinds, along with sheet music and carrying cases. Bags of every shape and size imaginable are found on racks and shelves in the back of the show area. Shields of all types are displayed behind the counters, some simple, some ornate and polished, all ready to serve as a strong defense against assailants. The display cases are filled with all kinds of shiny trinkets and knick-knacks that glitter and sparkle in the bright light of the sapphire glass lanterns hanging from the ceiling.  A sapphire winged Secian statue, a glass covered display case, and an open sapphire inlaid bluesteel door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Carte du Jour Route, Intersection.]

The rows of shops along South Merchant Avenue give way to several road houses, eateries, and upper-scale lodges. Beneath the flickering torches that flank a stately mahogany door, a covered vestibule protects those waiting for carriages from the elements. During business hours, porters wisk guest's luggage through a discreet service door. A pair of oak doors read "Circle Inn" in mahogany inlay. The torches cast long shadows onto this quiet corner of hotel row.  A pair of open oak and mahogany doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st drunk bar patron, the 2nd drunk bar patron, and the 3rd drunk bar patron.
Obvious paths: north* east west*.
go door
>[Circle Inn, Lobby.]

The Circle Inn lobby is lit by a cadre of glowing amber colored glass globes that lend a warm welcome to its guests. Richly polished mahogany sofa tables back a pair of sumptuous burgundy velvet couches. A black marble inlaid circular mahogany table sits between the sofas, topped by a dazzling floral arrangement of iris and orchids in an amber colored blown glass vase. A burgundy wool runner with light cream trim connects the entry to a wide stairway to the second floor. Several discreet porters await their assignments behind a dark walnut podium as the handsomely dressed manager handles the business end of each guest's arrival.  A pair of open oak and mahogany doors, some stairs going down, some stairs going up, and a NOTICE are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
shop list all
>There is no shop here!
re not
>
The NOTICE reads:
"The upper floors of the Inn are reserved for registered guests only. Any caught trespassing will be viewed as thieves and be removed by the use of force by the Circle Inn guard.
Thank you-
Circle Inn Management"

[Carte du Jour Route, East.]

The mouth-watering aroma of freshly baking bread fills the street surrounding a small porch. Several couples lounge sedately on small cafe tables protected from the elements by over-hanging eaves. A farmer leaves his cart-full of apple crates long enough to deliver another shipment of crisp, golden fruit to the backdoor of the shop.   An open polished walnut door is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
go door
>[Edward's Cider Shoppe.]

Two large glass-front display cases filled with fresh pastries stand on either side of a small wooden counter toward the back of the room. Long wooden shelves, containing glass pitchers, steel kettles and serving cups run along the rear wall, from side to side. A few roughly hewn tables are scattered in the front of the shop beneath orange gingham curtained windows.   An open polished walnut door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Carte du Jour Route, East.]

Two and four legged mongrels collect in this corner of the Merchant District, drawn by the delectable aromas of baking sweets. Even the stalwart guards cannot resist the tempting treats offered through the open pine door and patrol this small dead-end as much as the entire district.  A street lantern and an open butterscotch colored pine door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: west*.

>[The Sweet Tooth.]

The aroma of fresh baked goods and delectable sweets is overpowering inside this small shop. Jars filled with various candies are lined up in front of the polished wooden counter. Wooden shelves are packed to capacity with warm cookies, cakes, and pastries. Small revolving display cases on top of the counter contain an assortment of cupcakes and crullers. [Carte du Jour Route.]

The cobblestone path beneath your feet quickly gives way to multicolored polished tiles, arranged in a random fashion on the ground. Many shops of assorted size and wares line the sides of the road. A merchant can even be seenstanding in the street, announcing the lowest prices in the land on various items. A second merchant just down the road announces in a snide voice that such wares can be found even cheaper at his shop.  A holy symbol gold stamped alabaster door, an open decadent cafe entrance, and a glowing elegant wrought iron street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st smiling off-duty thugian guard*, the 1st drunk bar patron, and the 2nd drunk bar patron.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

go caf
[The Vistalique Revelryy.]

Entering you are greeted with the most fantastic aroma of distant recipes and exotic ingredients wafting through the air. Fragrant and strangely shaped brass oil lamps hang from the ceiling, casting ample but irregular light below. The walls are draped in bright velvets and interwoven with swirling burnished gold and silvers. On top of the etched sandstone and silken-carpeted flooring, a wide variety of brass and copper tables and adjoining chairs invite you to sit and enjoy a drink. Luckily there are a few unoccupied tables, as discerning customers have already claimed many. In the corners, booths skillfully draped with cloth ensure privacy from prying eyes. In the back an exotically clad go-blin-al chats with patrons from behind a copper topped counter, serving a wide variety of foreign food and drink. Nearby, soothing music streams from a talented pair of young musicians. You are just barely able to catch a glimpse of the flurry of activity in the kitchen through some flowing curtains behind the counter.  A copper topped glass counter, some dangerously tall copper barstools, some exotic style table and chairs, some orange pinstriped broadcloth reclining couches, and an open elegantly embossed copper door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

[Carte du Jour Route.]

Wondrous scents of baking goodies travels up and down the street, drawing the hungry and tired to rest inside the welcoming doors of an inviting eatery. A portly Human sporting a black velvet surcoat and black shiny boots escorts several scantily dressed ladies towards a rendezvous at one of the hotels along the street.  An open glossy lacquered oak door, a sign, and a glowing elegant wrought iron street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[The Traveler's Rest.]

The soft hum of quiet conversation from a variety of patrons lends to the cheerful and rejuvenating ambiance of this quaint eatery. The scandalous aroma of fresh baked pastries and dark roasted coffees and tea spices wafts past you as a serving girl bustles by with a tray laden with orders. Several cozy booths line the far wall, while a half dozen sturdy tables with oak legs and circular glass tops are scattered about the smooth golden pine floor. A jovial, old Human man stands behind a highly polished marble counter tending to the large brick oven along the back wall. Another stands ready to take your order. A finely crafted hat and cloak rack is placed near the door.  Some glass topped tables, some mahogany booths, a marble counter, a hat and coat rack, and an open lacquered oak door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Carte du Jour Route, Intersection.]

A hand-carved rosewood sign creaks in the light breeze reading, "Rose Eternal", a venerable landmark of Spur.  Delicate carvings chase across the front door and windows sashes in glowing, hand-polished rosewood. Two full flower boxes hang from the front windows, each overflowing with trailing rose bushes that bloom in hues that vary from soft pink to pink tinted white. A stout Drag-al barks at the crowds that pass, telling off-color jokes and smiling a huge obsequious grin. A cigar stubs smokes from his toothy grimace.   An open beautifully carved rosewood door and a glowing elegant wrought iron street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* west*.
go door
>[Rose Eternal Tavern]

Illumination from the dim oil lamps barely cuts through spilt drink and stale tobacco scented air.  A group of drag-als that seem to have become a permanent fixture here beckons you to join them for a pitcher of ale, and motions to the bartender indicating that you're paying.  Without bothering to acknowledge them, the bartender flashes a toothless grin toward a crowd more likely to have a few coins in their pockets, points them toward a table in the back and offers them an etched wood menu.  An open finely carved rosewood door, a small stage, and a slightly stained parchment placard on the bar are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Carte du Jour Route, Intersection.]

A hand-carved rosewood sign creaks in the light breeze reading, "Rose Eternal", a venerable landmark of Spur.  Delicate carvings chase across the front door and windows sashes in glowing, hand-polished rosewood. w
>[Carte du Jour Route, West.]

A cheerful red and white awning shades the entrance to Maynard's Butcher Shop. The bright red flagstones set before the front door have been meticulously scrubbed clean. Not a speck of dust occupies the window sashes nor door jams. Tempting links of sausages and thick savory hams beckon to passers-by through the sparkling window panes. Maynard himself guards the front door with a large straw broom, ready for any errant dust or vagrant mongrel to trespass.   A street lantern, a small gilded sign, and an open heavy sturdy oak door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east*.
go door
>[Butcher Shop.]

This front room houses the retail operation of one of the more respected businesses of Spur: that of Maynard the Butcher. Smoked hams, trussed turkeys and long chains of savory sausage links hang from the ceiling above several display cases. Ice packed display cases around the room attractively display lamb and veal chops, and steaks so thick they could choke a Thugian. Maynard's specialty is catering to his clientele, and exotic cuts are also available on request.  A thick wax curtain and an open heavy oak door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: None.
go door
>[Carte du Jour Route, West.]

A cheerful red and white awning shades the entrance to Maynard's Butcher Shop. The bright red flagstones set before the front door have been meticulously scrubbed clean. Not a speck of dust occupies the window sashes nor door jams. Tempting links of sausages and thick savory hams beckon to passers-by through the sparkling window panes. Maynard himself guards the front door with a large straw broom, ready for any errant dust or vagrant mongrel to trespass.   A street lantern, a small gilded sign, and an open heavy sturdy oak door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east*.
e
>[Carte du Jour Route, Intersection.]

A hand-carved rosewood sign creaks in the light breeze reading, "Rose Eternal", a venerable landmark of Spur.  Delicate carvings chase across the front door and windows sashes in glowing, hand-polished rosewood. Two full flower boxes hang from the front windows, each overflowing with trailing rose bushes that bloom in hues that vary from soft pink to pink tinted white. A stout Drag-al barks at the crowds that pass, telling off-color jokes and smiling a huge obsequious grin. A cigar stubs smokes from his toothy grimace.   An open beautifully carved rosewood door and a glowing elegant wrought iron street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* west*.
n
>[South Market Street.]

The center of this broad avenue is commanded by a tastefully sized polished gray granite fountain. The streets around the fountain are flooded with people of all races and sizes, rushing about from shop to shop. A group of Humans are standing just to one side of the fountain, conversing in their language, and gesturing at a particular shop that looks to cater to everyone but Humans. A San Elf stands just to one side, his eyes darting every now and then towards the groups coin purses.  A polished grey granite fountain, an open heavy wooden eight-paneled door, an open exquisite stained-glass trinket shop doorway, a glowing elegant wrought iron street lantern, and a moonsilver-etched sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st dirty street ruffian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
>
The dirty street ruffian returns to center rank.
go eig
[The Cupboard.]

Intricate red wood paneling lines the walls of this shop, darkening the room and soothing the eyes. Candle light flickers dimly from evenly spaced wall sconces adding a bit of mysticism to the store while the sweet smell of cedar permeates your senses. Several wooden mannequins around the room display a variety of fine articles of clothing. A large cedar humidor stands behind the smooth granite topped sales counter where a sharp featured San Elf leisurely awaits your request.  An open heavy wooden eight-paneled door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
shop list all

[South Market Street.]

The center of this broad avenue is commanded by a tastefully sized polished gray granite fountain. The streets around the fountain are flooded with people of all races and sizes, rushing about from shop to shop. A group of Humans are standing just to one side of the fountain, conversing in their language, and gesturing at a particular shop that looks to cater to everyone but Humans. go tri
>[Tempting Trinkets and Treasures.]

An assortment of small locked glass display cases atop finely carved mahogany pedestals are placed about this shop. Each case contains a unique and exquisite piece of fine jewelry, polished to shine in the light cast by the large glowing crystal chandelier hanging from the center of the ceiling.  A locked glass-fronted duskwood case towards the rear of the shop is filled with figurines, some more ordinary looking jewelry and assorted collectibles. One of the pale grey walls is covered with a beautiful mural of a forest grove - a light fog flecked with gold swirls in an archway formed by the trees and in the center are two gleaming golden eyes, the form of the muscular tiger they belong to barely outlined in the fog. The other walls are hung with charts listing the properties of precious and semi-precious gems and metals and the various methods of gemstone cutting.  A soft midnight blue leather upholstered couch, an open smooth edged pine charity bin, and an open exquisite stained-glass door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
shop list all

The center of this broad avenue is commanded by a tastefully sized polished gray granite fountain. n
>[South Market Street.]

This section of the road is dominated mostly by purveyors of specialty items made for more selective clients, many of which display discreet signs advertising their services. A particularly large storefront bears no sign at all. A cluster of Leuians is gathered around the entrance, most of them holding rather large sacks of coin.   An open sturdy blackened oak door, an open wooden door, and a glowing elegant wrought iron street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
go door
>[Lost and Found]

A bell above the door tinkles as you enter this cluttered shop. Light filters in through a dusty window and glints off various metals and gemstones around the room, a bright blue and purple glass mosaic lamp on the counter provides further illumination. Weapon and armor racks are scattered haphazardly around the room, though the most valuable are displayed on a pair of ornate racks in the center of the room. A glass-fronted curio cabinet against one wall allows for the display of jewelry, several lockpicks and an array of trinkets. The glass-fronted counter contains a number of carefully labeled bottles and jars. A tall, metallic silver-eyed youth clad in simple brown clothing apart from an ornate dragon-shaped bluesteel pendant sits on an old stool behind the cluttered counter, idly flipping through the pages of a book. Behind the shopkeeper atop a cluttered bookshelf is a heavy steelwood lockbox; deeply carved into its lid is an arcane rune that glows with a faint green light.   An open sturdy blackened oak door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
shop list all

>[Time Well Spent.]

The scent of jasmine fills the air as you enter, a small incense burner near the door gives off a few small clouds of smoke. The front windows of the shop allow plenty of light from the street to enter and show off it's wares. A young leuian walks forward to greet you, his eyes sparkling as he bows deeply before asking if he may help you with anything. A jewelry case separates the work area of the shop from the front. Gems of all shapes and sizes adorn the work bench.  A closed transparent glass case, a closed black oak display shelf, and an open wooden door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[South Market Street.]

This section of the road is dominated mostly by purveyors of specialty items made for more selective clients, many of which display discreet signs advertising their services. This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
>[Trade Way, Intersection.]

The throngs of travelers thicken along Trade Way between the Merchants Avenues and Market Streets.  An Anthian plays softly on a strange looking stringed instrument, her melodic voice filling the air. Judging by her clothing, and the number of silvers at her feet, she makes a fine living practicing her craft. Guards direct traffic in this clogged intersection.  A glowing elegant wrought iron street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.
n
>[North Market Street.]

Craftsmen mingle with well-dressed matrons along North Market Street. Foot traffic passes quickly near the major artery of Spur's merchant district; the flow and ebb of its walking tide predictable at lunch and after hours. Young cadets strut proudly in their new scholarly robes in varying hues of blue as they march towards their temple, praising Sa's might loudly. A loving Human couple strolls past admiring a set of matched sparkling yellow diamonds displayed on a box covered with celadon green velvet in the window.  A pair of tasteful embossed mahogany doors, an open lacquered silver maple door, and a glowing elegant wrought iron street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
go door
>[Entrance, Symher's Emporium.]

Brilliant streamers hang festooned in deep swaths of velvet and bright multicolored bolts of silk over pearly white walls. Two circular glass enclosures rise some eight spans toward the ceiling on either side of the grand doors. Gentle tinkling music plays in the background as, within the cases, stunning garments of all types are lifted softly into magickal animation. According to the smiling Human attendant, their lovely lilting dance is but one of the many wonders that can be found within this shopping complex. Bright gauzy sleeves shift and undulate in the area to the east.  A pair of beautiful handmade mahogany doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* east*.
shop list all
>There is no shop here!
n
>[Hues For You.]

A matronly Flerian looks up from a boiling cauldron of crimson dye. Quickly setting aside a brilliant tunic to dry, she removes an apron spattered with vibrant splashes that span the spectrum. Her rainbow colored hair magickally shifts from hue to hue as she steps gracefully forward whisking a color palette from beneath the counter and awaits a selection with a slow wink.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* south*.
shop list all
>Sorry, we don't sell things here.
e
>[The Hall of Fashion.]

This spacious section of the emporium is nearly filled to capacity as the audience stares in awe toward the catwalk that divides this area in two. Ravishing male and female models step onto the catwalk adorned in the finest religious robes, evening gowns, and other full bodied garments, welcomed by the appreciative applause of fashion connoisseurs representing all upscale publishing houses. A lithe Frontacian woman approaches and, with a bat of her deep blue eyes, offers a small card upon which to place an order from this season's collection.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* west*.
shop list all

>[Pierini's Gem Shop.]

The contents of several long glass covered display tables sparkle at you from across the room. Dozens of different gems are on display, available for purchase. Pierini's young Secian assistant sits behind a low counter, a jeweler's monocle in hand, ready to appraise or purchase gems that you might have for sale. Some cushioned benches line the walls, offering a comfortable place for waiting customers to sit.  A curtain and an open lacquered silver maple door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[North Market Street.]

Craftsmen mingle with well-dressed matrons along North Market Street. Foot traffic passes quickly near the major artery of Spur's merchant district; the flow and ebb of its walking tide predictable at lunch and after hours. Young cadets strut proudly in their new scholarly robes in varying hues of blue as they march towards their temple, praising Sa's might loudly. A loving Human couple strolls past admiring a set of matched sparkling yellow diamonds displayed on a box covered with celadon green velvet in the window.  A pair of tasteful embossed mahogany doors, an open lacquered silver maple door, and a glowing elegant wrought iron street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
>[North Market Street.]

Horse drawn carraiges pass dilapidated two-wheeled carts as items are purchased at the "going" price and replacements brought in by craftsmen, hoping to drive a good profit. A brightly dressed dandy prances past the Haberdashery, waving his dainty lace handkerchief at the smiling clerk inside. Just outside another doorway, a pretty San Elf maiden crouches, rubbing her ankle from the bad turn she took just teetering a few feet from the door in her new high-heeled snakeskin boots.  A stylish glass windowed mahogany door, an open iron studded pine door displaying a shoe, and a glowing elegant wrought iron street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
go door
>[Lutias' Haberdashery.]

Children giggle buoyantly as they do small chores around the store for a few coins. The seamstress scolds them loudly before turning back to the tall man, smiling as she measures him for a new outfit. The room smells of fragrant pipe smoke wafting through a doorway leading to a backroom. A tall Human man, handsomely dressed in fine clothes, awaits you at the counter ready to fill the incoming orders. A shiny silver plaque hangs upon the wall above the counter.  An engraved silver plaque and an open stylish glass windowed mahogany door are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Cobbler Shop]

The fragrance of newly cured leather filters through the dark, dusty air of the Cobbler Shop. A short, harried and hairy man of indistinguishable racial origin scurries around fitting boots, shoes and sandals on the feet of all who enter his shop. The constant "ping" of hammers on nails and leather sounds from a distant back room, punctuated occasionally with the loud curse of a mis-stroke.  Leather scraps of all colors cover the floor.   An iron studded pine door displaying a shoe is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[North Market Street.]

A slinky dressed female San Elf preens and giggles garnering the attention of several humans leaning out the window of the guards' quarters. Catcalls and whistles abound as she shows more thigh then is warranted. A wagon driver, distracted by the view, almost drives into a cart coming the opposite direction. Shouts are exchanged and fists shaken, as the San female snickers at all those involved.  An open beaded oliphant hide flap, a tanned leather sign, an open white pine moonsilk draped doorway, and a glowing elegant wrought iron street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
