>[Fur Traders.]

Huge lion pelts grace the walls of this store and bearskin rugs lie on the floor.  All manner of skins, pelts, and other animal parts cover every inch of available wall space, and many are stacked in piles on the floor.  A burly Hithual bedecked in a fur coat and cap sits on a stool in the corner sharpening a skinning knife. A sign on the wall reads, "We buy furs from Firs!".  A beaded oliphant hide flap is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

go drap
>[Seasonal Selections.]

The faintest chilly breeze winds its way through this shop, causing the delicate moonsilk snowflakes hanging from the ceiling to sway and spin as their crystal sequins catch the light and cast hypnotic white glimmers upon the cloudy blue walls. A set of tiny, icicle-shaped glass windchimes twirl and tinkle against each other, creating a soft melody that provides reprieve from the hustle and bustle of Spur's business district. Placed aesthetically about the enclosure are several white marble display cases and racks, all boasting ebony taloned Dragon feet at their sturdy bases. Behind a diminutive desk fashioned in a similar manner is a smiling Secian, with wings at the ready should a customer need help with an item or two. The items themselves reflect the current season, displayed proudly in the center of the store, while the sale items hang from a circular rack near the frosted bay window that provides a view into the Spurian market.  An open white pine moonsilk draped doorway is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[North Market Street.]

>[Aldwych Lane, Intersection.]

Where the brightly lit North Market Street collides with the darker Back Street, the heavy scent of fermented leaves and fruits wafts through an open door. Winter white lilies and violet roses entwine with ivy and grapevine to make delicate wreaths which adorns a post of the street lantern. The beautiful wreathe stands as a marker between the invisible boundaries separating the reputable from the opportunistic.  A smokey storm cloud grey ash door, a light blue rosewood sign, and a glowing elegant wrought iron street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* south* west.
go door
>[F'linor's Pipes and Trinkets.]

The inside of this dark room is filled with a fragrant smoke that hangs in the still air.  Drag-als of various sizes sit on soft leather chairs, smoking pipes and bragging of their latest practical jokes. F'linor stands in the center, a spot he obviously enjoys, bragging about the time he... when he suddenly turns to you and asks, "Oh did you need something?".  A smokey storm cloud grey ash door is here.

This room is illuminated.

>[Aldwych Lane.]

Even through the gloom of this darkened street a free spirit has shined their talent upon a narrow row-house that serves as a place of business. The inspired painter has splashed bright zig-zag patterns of magenta, orange, and yellow across cobblestone, wall and roof with a vision jarring consequence. The colors continue across the round door, making it nearly impossible to distinguish from the walls. Two young Flerian children with dirt caked feet count their tin boxes of shiny treasures on the stoop.  A street lantern and an open round door painted orange are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
go door
>[Jixi's Containers.]

Boxes on boxes, boxes in boxes, sacks in boxes, jars in boxes, boxes in sacks, and even one box in a jar are piled everywhere! If it weren't for a frantic flerian with orange hair pointing out a safe path while shouting "Careful of Jixi's pretties, big feets!" you'd have likely turned an ankle by now. A magickal sphere floating near the ceiling changes color every few minutes but manages to cast ample light to examine the multitude of containers for sale.   A glowing magickal sphere and an open round door painted orange are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Aldwych Lane, Intersection.]

The northeastern section of the merchant's district has been quietly cleared away and replaced by a brand new brick building. The clean red bricks have a new and well scrubbed look, the door is sturdy and and inviting. The small gilded sign that hangs over the entrance announcing "Aldo's Talisman Pendents" as the proprietor of this shop is covered with a carefully scrawled cardboard note saying, "NOW OPEN." w
>[Aldwych Lane.]

The dark line of old row-houses parts temporarily for a boisterous saloon with its black swinging doors that flings dead, partially dead and drunk patrons onto the mucky street.  A street lantern and a pair of skull inlaid ebony swinging doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
go sw
>[Bare Arsed Baboon Pawn & Saloon.]

Sawdust has barely settled on the floor and already rattan, pik, kobold, and go-blin-al alike are running amok. Mongrels of all breeds down tankards of booze while gambling on quick card games that, as a rule, end in violent bloodshed more often than not. The plinking of a tired old piano struggles to lend cheer to the lonesome atmosphere. Patrons here are quick to the draw. Wanted posters adorn the walls depicting many of their faces, serving for bragging rights rather than law officials. The bartender, a rather burly looking human with a thick mustache, stands behind the counter cleaning glasses with a rag and phlegmy wads of spit. A large crossbow mounted on the wall behind him remains loaded at all times, in case any of the patrons get too out of hand. With a reluctant nod, he motions towards shelves of items and a list of prices on the back wall.  An old Go-blin-al playing a piano, some crooked wooden tables, a dusty bar counter, some bolts stuck in the wall, a giant stuffed wall-mounted boar head, an old rickety wooden piano, a giant stuffed hairy baboon, and a pair of skull inlaid ebony swinging doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 2nd filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 3rd filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 4th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 5th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 6th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 7th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 8th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 9th filthy go-blin-al lacky, and the 10th filthy go-blin-al lacky.
Obvious exits: None.

  5 Wpn/Thrown creepy black spider                           Yes x19    50sp
  6 Shirts     shiny golden tassles (Too small)              Yes x1     75gp

shop ex 6

  Drag-al
  Flerian
  Go-blin-al

Unfortunately, you are not the right size for it.

The filthy go-blin-al lacky fumbles around in the quiver looking for an arrow, a panicked look spreading across its face.

The 3rd filthy go-blin-al lacky snorts loudly and spits out a green glob onto the ground.

The 8th filthy go-blin-al lacky beats a large war drum that booms ominously.

>[Bare Arsed Baboon Pawn & Saloon.]

Sawdust has barely settled on the floor and already rattan, pik, kobold, and go-blin-al alike are running amok. Mongrels of all breeds down tankards of booze while gambling on quick card games that, as a rule, end in violent bloodshed more often than not. The plinking of a tired old piano struggles to lend cheer to the lonesome atmosphere. Patrons here are quick to the draw. Wanted posters adorn the walls depicting many of their faces, serving for bragging rights rather than law officials. The bartender, a rather burly looking human with a thick mustache, stands behind the counter cleaning glasses with a rag and phlegmy wads of spit. A large crossbow mounted on the wall behind him remains loaded at all times, in case any of the patrons get too out of hand. With a reluctant nod, he motions towards shelves of items and a list of prices on the back wall.  An old Go-blin-al playing a piano, some crooked wooden tables, a dusty bar counter, some bolts stuck in the wall, a giant stuffed wall-mounted boar head, an old rickety wooden piano, a giant stuffed hairy baboon, and a pair of skull inlaid ebony swinging doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 2nd filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 3rd filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 4th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 5th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 6th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 7th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 8th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 9th filthy go-blin-al lacky, and the 10th filthy go-blin-al lacky.

Sawdust has barely settled on the floor and already rattan, pik, kobold, and go-blin-al alike are running amok. Mongrels of all breeds down tankards of booze while gambling on quick card games that, as a rule, end in violent bloodshed more often than not. The plinking of a tired old piano struggles to lend cheer to the lonesome atmosphere. Patrons here are quick to the draw. Wanted posters adorn the walls depicting many of their faces, serving for bragging rights rather than law officials. The bartender, a rather burly looking human with a thick mustache, stands behind the counter cleaning glasses with a rag and phlegmy wads of spit. A large crossbow mounted on the wall behind him remains loaded at all times, in case any of the patrons get too out of hand. With a reluctant nod, he motions towards shelves of items and a list of prices on the back wall.  An old Go-blin-al playing a piano, some crooked wooden tables, a dusty bar counter, some bolts stuck in the wall, a giant stuffed wall-mounted boar head, an old rickety wooden piano, a giant stuffed hairy baboon, and a pair of skull inlaid ebony swinging doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 2nd filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 3rd filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 4th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 5th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 6th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 7th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 8th filthy go-blin-al lacky, the 9th filthy go-blin-al lacky, and the 10th filthy go-blin-al lacky.

[Aldwych Lane, East.]

Shadows engulf this end of the the Merchant district, most of the shops catering to the more unusual tastes. Glass from the broken street lantern litters the ground where a street harlot attempts to woo clients. Several shadowy clusters of individuals whisper in hushed tones and gaze at you as you walk past. The sound of loud yelling emanates from one of the darkened shops before it is suddenly silenced.  A pitch black wrought iron door and a broken wrought iron street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: west.

[The Dark Side.]

This dark room is faintly illuminated by barely burning wrought iron torches that line the damp pitch-black brick walls. Screams of various races can be faintly heard echoing through the room, apparently coming from behind the walls. A cold and eerie chill sweeps through your body making you grin with delight, or shiver with fright as you peruse the vast shelves or merchandise all that seem to appeal to your darker side. An attractive Sanene female wearing a wickedly spiked thorn choker and a full studded leather body suit stands behind a cold iron counter glaring at you through her hypnotic pitch black eyes.  A blood red sign and a dark exit are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

>[Aldwych Lane, East.]

The multicolored cobblestone road leads past a giant casino. Faint sounds of shouting and occasional music echo from inside the building. Depending on the time of day or night, shifty looking San elf or Thugian stands sentry at the rear entrance. They gaze at you briefly to size you up before extending the offer of a "cheap pass" into the casino through a backdoor. Holding a hand out and waiting for the stipulated entrance fee, before unfastening a rope that holds the door shut, and allowing those who pay entrance.   A street lantern is here.

>[Lucky Luminations.]

A large, woven rush mat at the door welcomes you into a brightly lit shop.  The glossy golden pine floor and strategically placed mirrors on the walls gently reflect the light shed by dozens of different lamps, lanterns, and magikal illuminations.  A short, round, glass display case holds a selection of candles in a variety of hues and scents. Torches and lanterns are affixed to the walls in neatly spaced rows.  At the back of the shop a cheerful male Secian sits on a tall stool behind a mirrored counter.  Behind him float several magikal illumination orbs glowing a rainbow of different colors.   A glowing bright crimson paper lantern on a stick, a glowing Dragon patterned stained glass lantern, a glowing finely woven silver mesh cage of fireflies, and an opaque ruby red glass door are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Traveler's Emporium.]

You enter a large room with items of all sorts arranged neatly in mahogany and gold-trimmed glass display cases. Deep amber velvet curtains, set against rich royal blue walls, are opened wide to let in light from the street. A large candlelit crystal chandelier hangs from the ceiling, illuminating the room with dazzling color. Beside the large arched double doors are two display cases which stand out amongst the rest. Plush burgundy chairs and mahogany coffee tables are throughout the store to sit and look around in comfort, or perhaps join a friend for a bite to eat from a neighboring store. A light scent of spicy incense fills the room, and the warm ambience lends itself to a rich shopping experience. Some of the items for sale are mundane, yet necessary parts of everyday life, while others have more exotic uses and origins. The shopkeeper, with a friendly smile, is ready to sell ones every desire.   A pair of large arched double-doors, a closed display case and sign, and a closed display and placard are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st foreign merchant.

>[North Merchant Avenue.]

All along North Merchant Avenue shops, homes and offices are built in the shadow of Spur's inner west wall. Snippets of conversation from the guards above filters down to the clean, tended cobblestone roadway.  Above an old weathered door is a sign reading, "General Store".  The old shop, a staple of the Merchant District, occupies a newer bribrick building, replacing the old wooden fire trap. Directly across the street, a huge sign reads, "Hammer and Anvil", broadcasting its business.  A street lantern, an open worn weathered mahogany door, and a heavy mahogany door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

>[General Store.]

A stout elder human mans the battered wooden counter, attending his customers with terse courtesy. Shiny lanterns hang from the ceiling beams and small candles occupy a bushel barrel upon the counter.  Basic foods such as waybread and jerky are displayed in straw lined crates.  Casks of water line one wall and assorted backpacks and pouches hang on pegs in the back.   An open worn weathered mahogany door is here.

This room is illuminated.

>[The Hammer and Anvil.]

Behind a tall counter a well-dressed female with a short beard takes new orders and scurries to retrieve items for pickup. Behind her, industrious Hithuals work at several forges, filling the stout building with noise and smoke. Specializing in the repairing of old damaged equipment for adventurers, their services are in high demand. Their quality and quick turn over has earned them enough coin to garner one of the prime locations in the Spur.  A giant iron anvil, a wooden sign, and a heavy mahogany door are here.

This room is illuminated.

>[North Merchant Avenue.]

All along North Merchant Avenue shops, homes and offices are built in the shadow of Spur's inner west wall. Snippets of conversation from the guards above filters down to the clean, tended cobblestone roadway.  Above an old weathered door is a sign reading, "General Store".  The old shop, a staple of the Merchant District, occupies a newer bribrick building, replacing the old wooden fire trap. Directly across the street, a huge sign reads, "Hammer and Anvil", broadcasting its business.  A street lantern, an open worn weathered mahogany door, and a heavy mahogany door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
s
>[North Merchant Avenue.]

Traffic is brisk traversing this broad avenue where the locals comes to purchase trade items. The inner-city wall looms to the east where guards patrol constantly, their plumed helmets bobbing up and down as they patrol its length.  A fat Thugian enters through a shiny steel door, the straps and buckles of his new armor clinking as he strides past.  A Human father and his excited son leave the dark red stone door with a new sword grasped firmly in the younger man's hand.   A street lantern, an open brilliant mirrored steel door, and an open hand-carved carnelian chalcedony door are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Thick as a Brick.]

Several wooden mannequins display different types of armor on the floor of Thick as a Brick.  Cheaper suits of mail and armor are towards the front, while the more expensive and more fragile sets are in the back where a keen-eyed Fir Elf keeps an eye on them.  An open shiny steel door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

[Trade Way, Intersection.]

The monotonous line of dull grey buildings separate, revealing a massive domed building. The front walls of the building are dominated by glass panels displaying the latest fashions from several of the stores inside.  A pair of women carrying several shopping bags spin through the glass revolving doors while two grumpy looking men drag behind them with even larger bags. A large banner over the revolving doors proudly displays the name, "The Galleria", for all to see.   A street lantern and an open gold trimmed revolving glass door are here.

>You remove the enchanted delicate crystal spyglass from your bone pitch black bearskin berserker's cloak.

>[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, a short wooden stick, a slightly dented brass buckler, and a tattered old book of notes are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Kraxtor the Noble Arachnian, Blade the Noble Thugian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, and Isahn the Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
>You place the enchanted delicate crystal spyglass within your bone pitch black bearskin berserker's cloak.

>[Trade Way.]

Many townsfolk pass along this busy thoroughfare. Rich and poor alike mix freely on this street, much to the dismay of a passing nobleman. A young human struggles with an armful of packages and two young children in tow. Those in need of goods or supplies head west towards the market, those looking for the news of the day head east towards Town Square.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion.  Guards stand sentry from atop the wall as well as the ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: west*.
You cannot move in that direction.

>[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A freshly painted oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east*.

>[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Russa the Noble Human (holding a flaming handmade sapphire blue beeswax candle), Crax the Noble Leuian, and Aryianna the Noble Usil Elf.
Obvious exits: east* west*.

[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.
[Town Square.]

Two elegant buildings, one to the north and one to the west, stand on either side of a quickly degrading road. Nattily dressed patrons of the two establishments hurry to their destination, not pausing for fear of being robbed, or worse. To the northwest the houses steadily become more decrepit. A dark pallor of smoky air hangs heavily over the area.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Low Street.]

A darkly clad hoodlum leans against a worn street sign. He eyes those who pass by very carefully and then makes a few gestures into the shadows. All who are forced to travel upon this road have learned to keep one hand on their coin purse, the other on their weapon, and their wits about them.  A faded wooden sign and a glowing street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southeast* northwest*.

nw
>[Low Street.]

Low Street is the thoroughfare that carries people to the northwestern portion of Spur. The traffic along this road leans towards those without any viable economic means. Women who look older then their years, crippled old men and darkly clad shadowy figures all move stoically towards their destination. Only the plodding of worn shoes breaks the dismal silence.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
[Low Street.]

A beggar lies in a large pile of trash snoring deeply. His clothing is torn, filthy dirty, and a strong smell of alcohol wafts off of him. Sniffing around in the garbage, a hound looks for any scrap that can be eaten. The pup nudges the beggar and begins to rummage through the trash that he is using for bedding.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
[Low Street.]

Potholes and cracks in the road impede travel on this portion of Low Street. Maintenance is not considered a priority, due to the roads distance from the center of the city. Unimpeded by the poor condition of the street, several people gather around a nearby newsstand, reading the latest issue of the Spurian Free Press and discussing politics. Across the street from the newsstand a sign next to a weathered brown wooden door reads, "Spurian Free Press" in large, bold letters.   A street lantern, a closed weathered brown wooden door, and a wooden newsstand are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
nw
[Low Street.]

Low Street ends at a gate that stands permanently ajar, its mechanism jammed and broken. Set in the massive city walls between Town Square and Spur's Poor Quarter, the gates rickety appearance befits that which lies behind it. Loud and colorful words, mixing with the sound of playing children can be heard from within.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast*.

>[Dank & Dismal.]

Just inside the gate from Town Square, the intersection of Dismal and Dank streets meet into a corner. Whole sections of buildings are being ripped out, demolishing them piece by piece. A couple of beggars incoherently plea for something despite the food they have in their hands.  A glowing street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north southeast* west northwest*.

n
>[Dismal Lane.]

A large section of buildings on the west side of the street is now gone. The constant noises of construction and demolition pound away at all hours. The street is immaculately clean save the tons of stones piled along the poor quarter wall. The street stones extend westward, paving the beginnings of a large square shaped area. A tall stone building, painted a deep sable, rises against the poor quarter wall. Shabbily dressed people enter and exit the building rapidly. Many exit carrying bundles of papers. A faint haze of smoke drifts from the buildings doorway.  A pile of stones and an open wide smoke filled doorway are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south* southwest west*.
[Dismal Lane.]

The broken and shattered remains of the Temple of Set litter the road and the spot where the temple once stood. Beggars and poor folk stand staring forlornly at the remains. A few make their way through the broken gate, some crying and some showing no emotion at all. Offerings to Set have been placed all around and litter the area.  An open large wooden gate and some stairs are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south* west*.
[Dismal Lane.]

An eagle-emblazoned hostel and a large school house stand out amidst the broken down houses. A small group of children gather around an adolescent boy with the face of an old man. He smirks at the children on their way to school, while his followers openly taunt them. A teacher takes a step toward the boy as if to shoo him away, but thinks better of it and retreats back into the school.  An open crudely marked door and an open schoolhouse door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south*.
[Dismal Lane.]

Dismal Lane meanders along between crowded buildings. Some appear to be uninhabited with windows and doors boarded over. Many of the other buildings have undergone some refurbishment and are fronted by freshly painted doors and windows. Around the base of the trees that have been planted along the street someone has planted rings of daisies. On the side of the street, a gang of young Thugians taunt a human child, pushing him back and forth. There is neither fear nor anger on the child's face, only dull, apathetic acceptance.  An open blue door, a scented lilac tree, a scented lilac tree, and some cheerful yellow and white daisies are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south*.
n
>[Dismal Lane.]

Dismal Lane continues on a crooked path north and south. A side street branches to the west and is quickly lost in the shadows. A ramshack looking building that seems to be almost leaning sideways stands out on the corner, a small dented sign hangs from above the swinging wooden doors that reads, "Tarnished Tankard Tavern and Inn". From the look of the patrons milling around outside, this is anything but a high class establishment.  A pair of broken swinging wooden doors are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Dark cult altar]

Mystical chants echo through this area, where the cultists obviously gather to serve their deity.  Their holy symbol is carved on the pulpit in the western corner of the room, while prayer rugs cover the floor. Black candles flicker on the altar by the northwestern wall. Small statuettes stand on pedestals in alcoves lining the side walls. An archway leads southeast.  A blood-stained black marble altar, a darkened ceremonial archway, some rubble, and a small clump of rubble are here.

This room is illuminated.

>[Secret tunnel.]

A small puddle of water has formed at the southwest end of this secret passageway. Just beyond the puddle, the tunnel ends in a large banner, concealing the tunnel from the view of the people in the room behind it. The tunnel appears to slope gently upwards to the northeast.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st cult fanatic and the 2nd cult fanatic.
Obvious exits: northeast*.

A cult fanatic enters, following Hroomha.

A cult fanatic enters, following Hroomha.
[Secret tunnel.]

The dark, dank passageway continues onward. A faint acrid smell wafts in from somewhere, and you sense a dark presence close by. You feel a strong desire to hurry onward.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st cult fanatic and the 2nd cult fanatic.
Obvious exits: northeast* southwest*.

A cult fanatic enters, following Hroomha.

A cult fanatic enters, following Hroomha.
[Secret tunnel.]

The northeastern end of this secret passageway exits to an alcove. A statue stands just beyond the end of the tunnel, concealing it from the view of people in the room beyond. The tunnel slopes slightly downward as it heads off to the southwest.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st cult fanatic and the 2nd cult fanatic.
Obvious exits: southwest*.

A cult fanatic enters, following Hroomha.

A cult fanatic enters, following Hroomha.
[Dark cult altar]

Mystical chants echo through this area, where the cultists obviously gather to serve their deity.  Their holy symbol is carved on the pulpit in the western corner of the room, while prayer rugs cover the floor. Black candles flicker on the altar by the northwestern wall. Small statuettes stand on pedestals in alcoves lining the side walls. An archway leads southeast.  A blood-stained black marble altar, a darkened ceremonial archway, some rubble, and a small clump of rubble are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st cult fanatic and the 2nd cult fanatic.
Obvious exits: None.

[Warehouse.]

From the inside, this building looks like a small warehouse. Crates are stacked upon the floor, yet upon closer examination, they appear to be empty. No ordinary warehouse would have such a flow of cultists wandering through it either. You are left with the feeling that there is more to this building than meets the eye. A door leads outside.  An open thick oak door and a hidden staircase are here.

e
>You may act at any time!
Attack strategy set to: Frenzied -- Throw caution to the wind.
[Dismal Lane.]

Dismal Lane continues on a crooked path north and south. A side street branches to the west and is quickly lost in the shadows. A ramshack looking building that seems to be almost leaning sideways stands out on the corner, a small dented sign hangs from above the swinging wooden doors that reads, "Tarnished Tankard Tavern and Inn". From the look of the patrons milling around outside, this is anything but a high class establishment.  A pair of broken swinging wooden doors are here.

s
>[Dismal Lane.]

Dismal Lane meanders along between crowded buildings. Some appear to be uninhabited with windows and doors boarded over. Many of the other buildings have undergone some refurbishment and are fronted by freshly painted doors and windows. Around the base of the trees that have been planted along the street someone has planted rings of daisies. On the side of the street, a gang of young Thugians taunt a human child, pushing him back and forth. There is neither fear nor anger on the child's face, only dull, apathetic acceptance.  An open blue door, a scented lilac tree, a scented lilac tree, and some cheerful yellow and white daisies are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south.

[Dismal Lane.]

Dismal Lane meanders along between crowded buildings. Some appear to be uninhabited with windows and doors boarded over. Many of the other buildings have undergone some refurbishment and are fronted by freshly painted doors and windows. Around the base of the trees that have been planted along the street someone has planted rings of daisies. On the side of the street, a gang of young Thugians taunt a human child, pushing him back and forth. There is neither fear nor anger on the child's face, only dull, apathetic acceptance.  An open blue door, a scented lilac tree, a scented lilac tree, and some cheerful yellow and white daisies are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south.
[Dismal Lane.]

An eagle-emblazoned hostel and a large school house stand out amidst the broken down houses. A small group of children gather around an adolescent boy with the face of an old man. He smirks at the children on their way to school, while his followers openly taunt them. A teacher takes a step toward the boy as if to shoo him away, but thinks better of it and retreats back into the school.  An open crudely marked door and an open schoolhouse door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south.

>[Dismal Lane.]

Dismal Lane continues on a crooked path north and south. A side street branches to the west and is quickly lost in the shadows. A ramshack looking building that seems to be almost leaning sideways stands out on the corner, a small dented sign hangs from above the swinging wooden doors that reads, "Tarnished Tankard Tavern and Inn". From the look of the patrons milling around outside, this is anything but a high class establishment.  A pair of broken swinging wooden doors are here.
cults west

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st cult fanatic.
Obvious paths: north south* west.
>You advance another 1 UDs!

>
A cult fanatic enters, following Hroomha.
[Dismal Lane.]

Dismal Lane meanders along between crowded buildings. Some appear to be uninhabited with windows and doors boarded over. Many of the other buildings have undergone some refurbishment and are fronted by freshly painted doors and windows. Around the base of the trees that have been planted along the street someone has planted rings of daisies. On the side of the street, a gang of young Thugians taunt a human child, pushing him back and forth. There is neither fear nor anger on the child's face, only dull, apathetic acceptance.  An open blue door, a scented lilac tree, a scented lilac tree, and some cheerful yellow and white daisies are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st cult fanatic.
Obvious paths: north* south.
s
>
A cult fanatic enters, following Hroomha.
[Dismal Lane.]

An eagle-emblazoned hostel and a large school house stand out amidst the broken down houses. A small group of children gather around an adolescent boy with the face of an old man. He smirks at the children on their way to school, while his followers openly taunt them. A teacher takes a step toward the boy as if to shoo him away, but thinks better of it and retreats back into the school.  An open crudely marked door and an open schoolhouse door are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st cult fanatic.
Obvious paths: north* south.
s
>[Dismal Lane.]

The broken and shattered remains of the Temple of Set litter the road and the spot where the temple once stood. Beggars and poor folk stand staring forlornly at the remains. A few make their way through the broken gate, some crying and some showing no emotion at all. Offerings to Set have been placed all around and litter the area.  An open large wooden gate and some stairs are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south west*.

[Dismal Lane.]

A large section of buildings on the west side of the street is now gone. The constant noises of construction and demolition pound away at all hours. The street is immaculately clean save the tons of stones piled along the poor quarter wall. The street stones extend westward, paving the beginnings of a large square shaped area. A tall stone building, painted a deep sable, rises against the poor quarter wall. Shabbily dressed people enter and exit the building rapidly. Many exit carrying bundles of papers. A faint haze of smoke drifts from the buildings doorway.  A pile of stones and an open wide smoke filled doorway are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st cult fanatic.
Obvious paths: north* south* southwest west*.
s
>[Dank & Dismal.]

Just inside the gate from Town Square, the intersection of Dismal and Dank streets meet into a corner. Whole sections of buildings are being ripped out, demolishing them piece by piece. A couple of beggars incoherently plea for something despite the food they have in their hands.  A glowing street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st street urchin.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west northwest*.

go gate
>[Low Street.]

Low Street ends at a gate that stands permanently ajar, its mechanism jammed and broken. Set in the massive city walls between Town Square and Spur's Poor Quarter, the gates rickety appearance befits that which lies behind it. Loud and colorful words, mixing with the sound of playing children can be heard from within.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast*.

A cult fanatic enters, following Hroomha.
[Low Street.]

Potholes and cracks in the road impede travel on this portion of Low Street. Maintenance is not considered a priority, due to the roads distance from the center of the city. Unimpeded by the poor condition of the street, several people gather around a nearby newsstand, reading the latest issue of the Spurian Free Press and discussing politics. Across the street from the newsstand a sign next to a weathered brown wooden door reads, "Spurian Free Press" in large, bold letters.   A street lantern, a closed weathered brown wooden door, and a wooden newsstand are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st cult fanatic.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.
se
>[Low Street.]

A beggar lies in a large pile of trash snoring deeply. His clothing is torn, filthy dirty, and a strong smell of alcohol wafts off of him. Sniffing around in the garbage, a hound looks for any scrap that can be eaten. The pup nudges the beggar and begins to rummage through the trash that he is using for bedding.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.

[Low Street.]

Low Street is the thoroughfare that carries people to the northwestern portion of Spur. The traffic along this road leans towards those without any viable economic means. Women who look older then their years, crippled old men and darkly clad shadowy figures all move stoically towards their destination. Only the plodding of worn shoes breaks the dismal silence.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st cult fanatic.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.

[Low Street.]

A darkly clad hoodlum leans against a worn street sign. He eyes those who pass by very carefully and then makes a few gestures into the shadows. All who are forced to travel upon this road have learned to keep one hand on their coin purse, the other on their weapon, and their wits about them.  A faded wooden sign and a glowing street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st cult fanatic.
Obvious exits: southeast* northwest*.

>[Town Square.]

Two elegant buildings, one to the north and one to the west, stand on either side of a quickly degrading road. Nattily dressed patrons of the two establishments hurry to their destination, not pausing for fear of being robbed, or worse. To the northwest the houses steadily become more decrepit. A dark pallor of smoky air hangs heavily over the area.  A street lantern is here.

>A cult fanatic enters, following Hroomha.
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, a short wooden stick, a slightly dented brass buckler, and a tattered old book of notes are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st cult fanatic.
In the area are Kraxtor the Noble Arachnian (seated), Blade the Noble Thugian, Tchori the Leuian, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual (seated), Isahn the Psycian, and Nae'blis the Noble Arachnian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

>[Side street.]

This side street is deeply masked by shadows. It starts to twist and turn as it enters the alleyways behind the houses. The makeshift roofing above seems to cut off what little light might ever filter in. Someone seems to want it dark here.  An open crooked red wooden door is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* west northwest.
go door
>[Small Room.]

Upon entering this small home one can see a low-lit fire crackling in the fireplace. It has a small cooking pot hanging over the flames sending a wonderful aroma of spices into the air. A small wooden rocking chair sits in the corner of the room unattended, but shows signs of its use by the scuffs in the neatly kept floor. The floor is a redwood and very appealing to the eyes and, also, has a small fur rug that sits in the middle of the floor. Next to the old chair one can see a sewing basket with a large needle sticking out of it, and a picture of a soldier sits on mantle of the fireplace.  A woven reed chair, a flaming cook fire, an open door, and a mysterious beaded curtain are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

[Spur Gateway.]

Five fishermen recline on folding chairs or against rocks, tethered by the silvery lines of their poles to the fishing hole. [Silver River Bridge.]

Mismatched mortar colors and varying types and cuts of the stone show the extent of the reconstruction made by quick working masons. Bright banners flutter in the breeze on both sides of the bridge as if in celebration of its victory over both the river's truculence and sabotage.

>[North Bridge Trail.]

On the northern edge of the road stands a tall, flat rock. Chipped into the shape of a pillar and abraded to smoothness, it bears the stamped surveyor's mark of the road's builder. The mark's grooved letters are filled with sand and dust and obscured from age, but the arrows delineating north, south, east and west are clear and easy to read. The rest of the stamp is undecipherable and lends mystery to the road's origin.

A great rend in the higher foothills slashes the through the rippled lands resulting in a long, narrow valley. Broken rocks and tumbled boulders fill the agitated valley floor, which harbors little vegetation. The merchant road follows a slight turn in the valley.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st ogre.
Obvious paths: north southeast*.

An ogre enters, following Hroomha.
[Tarath Bends.]

Often referred to as "badlands", the sheered rocks, broken cliffs and ridged terrain would be impassable if not for the road. A narrow, steep walled canyon juts to the southeast, disappearing into the convoluted, rippled hills. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st carnivorous toad and the 1st ogre.
Obvious paths: northeast south*.
[Tarath Bends.]

A short vibration shudders the roadbed, causing dust and gravel to shimmy down the canyon walls. A few larger rocks ping and ricochet off boulders, until all is deadly silent.  The merchant road is dusted with bits of broken rock, covering any recent tracks. 

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southwest* northwest.
[Tarath Bends.]

The rocky valley walls widen to the accommodate the splitting of the Tarath fault line. The Great Divide towers to the north beyond the fractured, broken badlands. Sheer, monolithic cliffs dropping for thousands of feet front the western edge of the mountains; their sharp, snow-capped peaks vaulting nearly vertically from the floor of the fault line valley. The merchant road bed is cracked and broken as it negotiates the larger twists and turns.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest.
[Tarath Bends.]

w
w
nw
The trembling fault line reveals the cataclysmic trauma of the solid bedrock beneath the mountains. Striations of tortured, twisted rock bent almost in half under the strain stand out dramatically against darker, older layers of bedrock.
west to wolf-script not off yet

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* west.
>[Tarath Bends.]

A short tremor suddenly rocks the cracked merchant road! A dusty pall sifts into the air from cracks in the ground and the shifting of gravel around the valley.  The tremor rolls through the canyon walls like a ripple, as if it were a linen sheet that was lifted and settled again. Pack animals and travelers alike stop momentarily and then hasten their pace as if to leave the quake behind them.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west.
[Tarath Bends.]

As the merchant road approaches the western end of the valley, the valley wall abruptly falls away to a sheer drop. Crumbling rock and dirt spill constantly into the deep abyss. Sections of the mountain have slid away into the valley and the merchant road has been rebuilt higher along the steeper sides of the mountain. The fault line of broken rocks continues its path of destruction to the west, skirted by the land-slide prone softer dirt.   A freshly uncovered crevice is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* northwest.
[Tarath Bends.]

A treacherous dusty trail leads west along the shaky fault line from a fork in the main road. The original roadbed has fallen into the chasm years ago, leaving the merchants to their own wiles to ply the slippery slopes past the fault zone. Many attempts have failed at conquering the shifting dirt and rocks. Currently a bumpy trail skirts the bigger rocks and loose gravel.   A wide eyed merchant's corpse is here.

[Dusty Road.]

A ways to the north, you can see a town in the distance. A rusty gate stands up ahead, offering entrance to the shady looking village. Not much activity can be seen from the buildings.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south*.
[Dusty Road.]

An obnoxious creaking sound can be heard up to the north, as a rusty old gate swings in the dry breeze. The gate offers entrance to the dormant looking town, but provides no defense from intruders.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south*.
[Dusty Road.]

You stand before a gate about 3 feet high, yellowing and rusty from years of use. It doesn't look like anyone takes care of it regularly. A sign is sticking out of the ground off the side of the path, slightly crooked. The writing on the board is crudely scrawled into the wood, reading "Wolf Trap". You can only assume that is the name given to the quiet town seen past the gate.  An open rusting gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south*.
[Wolf Trap.]

Further up the road, you can make out what seems to be the center of the town. Dank, shady buildings line the dusty road through town. There is little if any activity here.  An open rusty gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north.

>[Wolf Trap.]

This area is illuminated.

[Wolf Trap.]

To the north you can see the Town Square.  Although usually the local gathering spot, this Square appears bleak and deserted.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north south*.
[Wolf Trap-Town Square.]

The area around you seems lifeless and empty. Dominating the otherwise bare Town Square is a large fountain. The fountain's base is circular, with the statue of a wolf howling at the moon in the middle. The structure is devoid of water, and the stone has grown faded and bleached from the sun. Faded marks, where the fountain water used to flow, run down the wolf's chin.  A faded dry stone fountain is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north northeast southeast south* southwest northwest.

Obvious paths: southeast northwest*.
se
[Wolf Trap]

A strange pile of rubble is farther up to the northwest, and the faint smell of smoke lingers in the air, though none can be seen. 

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast northwest*.
[Wolf Trap-Town Square.]

The area around you seems lifeless and empty. Dominating the otherwise bare Town Square is a large fountain. The fountain's base is circular, with the statue of a wolf howling at the moon in the middle. The structure is devoid of water, and the stone has grown faded and bleached from the sun. Faded marks, where the fountain water used to flow, run down the wolf's chin.  A faded dry stone fountain is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north northeast southeast south southwest northwest*.
ne
ne
>[Wolf Trap]

The sides of the road are lined with dark, shady buildings. An irritating silence fills the area as you walk the dusty roads of Wolf Trap.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast southwest*.
ne
>[Wolf Trap]

The desolation is closing in on you.  Where is everyone?  Why has this town fallen?  About the only movement you find is from the tumbleweeds bouncing through the streets.

This area is illuminated.

A small patch of brownish-green grass fills the area. The brush crunches softly beneath your feet. A square shape seems to be carved into the ground...

go tr
>[Cavern]

An underground cavern has been concealed from the town above, and seems to be much more lively than any other place you've encountered. Some townsfolk are sleeping in shabby tents, while others sit in small groups and eye you warily, growing silent as you draw near.  An open trapdoor is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southeast*.
se
>[Market.]

A few people trade their meager goods with each other at what passes as the Wolf Trap marketplace. Most of the village's children scamper about, snacking on jerky and playing ring games.

n
>[Market.]

A few people trade their meager goods with each other at what passes as the Wolf Trap marketplace. Most of the village's children scamper about, snacking on jerky and playing ring games.
market

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* south* northwest*.
e
>[Healer's Line.]

Some injured people line up in front of a local healer. For a few dirty silver coins, she heals their wounds. A rocky slope begins to the northeast, where it appears to be more difficult to move.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast* west*.

l at h
>You find something suitably reflective and gaze into it...

You look like a 8'0" standard adolescent delicate boned, stocky bodied Oog-ra.
You have very long, tied back, kinky chestnut brown fur, with large reddish brown eyes, and look disheveled.
You appear to be cold right now.
You can be attacked by other players.

On his left arm is a tattoo of a menacing-looking pink flamingo standing defiantly in a ring of purple flowers surrounded by a ring of flame..

On his neck is a black barbarian tattoo.

You have no apparent injuries, but look fatigued.
There is a shining gold emblem affixed to your clothing.

Physical appearance:

You see a large hairy oog-ra standing before you, with old scars covering most of his body...

                        Visible Equipment
A short burnished silver mace                      (right hand)
Some giant bone trimmed steel plate armor          (armor)
Some intricately swirled tribal face paint         (on head)
A twinkling pitch black strand of love beads       (around neck)
Some swirling nightstone wraith charms             (on feet)
A bone pitch black bearskin berserker's cloak      (over armor)
An obsidian ring of Taath                          (ring (left))
A blood-stained wool skirt                         (pants)
A squirming knotted belt of live rats              (on belt)

You have been bestowed the following title(s):
  Noble of the Realm

[Healer's Line.]

Some injured people line up in front of a local healer. For a few dirty silver coins, she heals their wounds. A rocky slope begins to the northeast, where it appears to be more difficult to move.

[Market.]

A few people trade their meager goods with each other at what passes as the Wolf Trap marketplace. Most of the village's children scamper about, snacking on jerky and playing ring games.
market

>[Cavern]

An underground cavern has been concealed from the town above, and seems to be much more lively than any other place you've encountered. Some townsfolk are sleeping in shabby tents, while others sit in small groups and eye you warily, growing silent as you draw near.  An open trapdoor is here.

This room is illuminated.
